title: Factor into Primes
text: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than $$1$$, whose only factors are $$1$$ and itself. The first few prime numbers are: $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$11$$, $$13$$, etc.
speech: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than  1 , whose only factors are  1  and itself. The first few prime numbers are:  2 ,  3 ,  5 ,  7 ,  11 ,  13 , etc.

title: Identify Common Factors in each Column
text: $$21b^2=7\times3 b b$$\n$$14b=7\times2 b$$\n$$7$$ and $$b$$ are shared by both expressions.
speech: 21 b squared, is equal to 7 times 3 b b \n 14 b is equal to 7 times 2 b, \n 7  and  b  are shared by both expressions.
